title: How to Applique a Baby Bib

steps.headline: Cut out the template you plan to use for the appliqué.
steps.description: Select a simple pattern to make the project an easy one.

steps.headline: Cut out the bondaweb around the template.
steps.description: You can do a rough cut for this step.

steps.headline: Place the bondaweb cut out on the scrap of fabric.
steps.description: Make sure to have the "rough" side or adhesive side down on the fabric scrap.

steps.headline: Press the area with a medium-cool iron.
Place the template on the bondaweb and carefully trace around it using a pencil.
Peel the backing paper off the bondaweb and position it on the bib.
Press again with the iron using a medium-cool heat setting.
Turn the bib over and press on the other side.
Place the template on the interlining and make a rough cut around it.
Pin a few sewing pins on the right side of the bib.
Apply the rough cut interlining piece on the wrong side of the bib using the sewing pins as a placement guide.
steps.description: Make sure the rough side (the adhesive side) is placed against the bib fabric.

steps.headline: Press with a medium cool iron over the interlining piece.
Sew around the appliqué using a tight zig-zag sewing stitch.
Use a slow stitch speed, and a steady pace, while sewing the outside edges of the appliqué for the best results.
Trim loose threads on both sides of the project.
Admire your handiwork as the project is done.

text: Cut out the template you plan to use for the appliqué. Select a simple pattern to make the project an easy one. Cut out the bondaweb around the template. You can do a rough cut for this step. Place the bondaweb cut out on the scrap of fabric. Make sure to have the "rough" side or adhesive side down on the fabric scrap. Press the area with a medium-cool iron.  Place the template on the bondaweb and carefully trace around it using a pencil.  Cut out the appliqué.  Peel the backing paper off the bondaweb and position it on the bib.  Press again with the iron using a medium-cool heat setting.  Turn the bib over and press on the other side.  Place the template on the interlining and make a rough cut around it.  Pin a few sewing pins on the right side of the bib.  Apply the rough cut interlining piece on the wrong side of the bib using the sewing pins as a placement guide. Make sure the rough side (the adhesive side) is placed against the bib fabric. Press with a medium cool iron over the interlining piece.  Remove the sewing pins.  Sew around the appliqué using a tight zig-zag sewing stitch.  Use a slow stitch speed, and a steady pace, while sewing the outside edges of the appliqué for the best results.  Trim loose threads on both sides of the project.  Admire your handiwork as the project is done.
